Sure, here's a revised version of the email:

Hello,

I'm excited to share with you how I'm using Share GPT at the community college where I work in Texas. As an English instructor, I'm often asked to work with Distance Ed and Educational Technology Departments, and I learned about Share GPT while attending a webinar for the Hypothes.is social annotation tool.

I'm using Share GPT in multiple ways, including for professional development activities, in my own classes, and in departmental discussions. I've found it to be a great tool for fostering academic integrity and sparking a genuine interest in learning. As chair of an advisory committee, I'm using Share GPT to demonstrate its potential for promoting academic integrity and to help revise our Online Teaching Certification Course for recently hired faculty.

I plan to use either Hypothes.is or Share GPT's chat feature for annotation and discussion, and I'm also creating an assignment for faculty to generate threads and share links to promote the use of Share GPT in course design. In my own classes, I'm using Padlet to save Share GPT threads and want to promote its use in my department and other departments.

I have a question about using the chat feature in small group discussions, but I'm unable to test it currently as the chat feature isn't showing up on the share links I've saved. I'm looking forward to exploring this feature further once it's available.

Thank you for creating such an excellent tool. I'm excited to see how Share GPT can continue to support innovative teaching and learning practices.

Best regards, [Your name]
